sentences: Ära jookse, niikuinii me ei jõua.
context: The Estonian word 'niikuinii' is an adverb that expresses certainty, inevitability, or the idea of 'anyway', 'regardless', or 'in any case'. It indicates that something will happen no matter what, often used to emphasize that certain outcomes are unavoidable or that a particular action will be taken despite other factors. The word can also convey resignation about inevitable circumstances.
